DN1210-018 ITP Gas Protection Structure
template name: DN1210-018 ITP Gas Protection Structure Rev 0

name: SECTION 3 – PRE-CONSTRUCTION - MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
Detail - All Reinforcement bars and strands used in structural concrete to be approved by the engineer prior to construction.
○ Post tensioning strand to be high tension ASTM galvanized and complying with AS/NZ standard

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Test certificates shall be obtained from the manufacturer for all strand, cable and bar to be used in the work and copies shall be forwarded to the Engineer at least one week before the programmed commencement of any work incorporating these materials. Test certificates shall be traceable to the batch of material supplied to the work.
○ High yield steel, Grade 500E, Seismic MA.
Verifying Document - Supplier data sheet/ Mill certs
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction

Detail - Approved mix design - Concrete shall be of the class as defined by NZS 3104 have a minimum 28 days compression strength as specified for various members: for Gas Main protection structure in-situ pour: 40mpa
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 28 Day concrete requirements:
○ In Situ Footing and stitch pour for Gas Main Protection structure: 40MPA
○ Screw Pile Shaft filled with 40Mpa Concrete
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Shop drawing review and approval from Engineer and Production QA Records to be submitted

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Send shop drawings to the Engineer for review, at least 14 days prior to manufacture of any pre cast members. Any variations between the Drawings and shop drawings shall be clearly identified and brought to the attention of the Engineer.
Verifying Document - Shop Drawing Approval, QA records
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Pre approved joint sealant meeting the specification requirements

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Joints are to be sealed using a fuel resistant, multi-component polysulphide sealant designed for horizontal and vertical joints in concrete and is joint sealant pourable or gunning grade as appropriate.
Verifying Document - Delivery dockets and supplier data sheet
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction - Engineers approval

Detail - The Length of the Screw Pile delivered to the site will be long enough for both, Type 1 pile (dia 168mm, 6.4mm thick) and Type 2 pile (dia 273mm, 12.7mm thick). Need to be 11.95m long with Helix as indicated on Spiral Drillers shop drawing of the pile. Helix to be 450mm dia 15mm thick for Type 1 pile and 750mm dia, 25mm thick for Type 2 pile. The External Bearing Ring for Type 1 pile should be 250mm and 41mm thick. For Type 2 pile 350mm and 39mm thick
Standard / Specification - Spiral Drillers Pile Details, Drawing No. 1
Verifying Document - Delivery dockets and Visual Inspection
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Compressible filler board specification to meet the project requirements.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Details of the compressible filler board proposed to be used as a construction joint shall meet specification requirements.
Verifying Document - Delivery dockets and supplier data sheet
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Engineer to inspect all foundation surface inspections
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Across stripped area
SECTION 5 – CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES - SCREW PILING, INSITU POUR, PRE-CAST CONCRETE
Detail - Pile heads must be within +-75mm of the specified plan location. Pile heads must be within +-20mm of the vertical level indicated on the drawings
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The verified data is within tolerance as specified
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Post construction

Detail - The minimum pile founding depth for all helices shall be 9.5m below existing ground level AND Target Installation Torque 168mm dia shaft= 15000NM Target Installation Torque 273mm dia shaft=45000Nm Note: Max allowable Torque 168mm dia shaft=70000Nm Max Allowable Torque 273mm dia shaft=120000Nm-However on-site digger will allow Maximum Torque of 90000Nm
Standard / Specification - Spiral Drillers Pile Details, Drawing No. 1 and AoS design Report
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 2 Site Visits
Detail - Pile Shaft to be filled with 40Mpa Concrete
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pile Shaft to be filled with 40Mpa Concrete
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Post Construction

Detail - The bearing plate will be lowered over the top of the screw pile to its design height (200mm from base of abutment/wingwall cap). Once at height it will be tack welded in position. Bearing plate and stiffening ring to then be welded using a partial penetration butt weld.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Post construction
Detail - Pre Pour inspection to check:

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Engineer shall be informed 8 hours prior to the casting of any unit, to allow the Engineer to attend the pre-casting plant to inspect before and during production of the units.
○ Reinforcing shall be pre assembled wherever possible into rigid cages using a template or jig. Reinforcing shall be tied together with wire unless otherwise accepted by the Engineer
○ Confirm correct type and location of cover block is used.
Verifying Document - Pre pour inspection checklist, Manufacturer QA records
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Engineers Approval
Detail - Pre cast Methodology from Pre co to submit to Engineer and Compression Test Report

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - For pours under 150m³: three standard cylinders shall be made for each 50m³ of concrete placed, or part thereof, for testing of 28 days compressive strength in an approved laboratory.
Verifying Document - Slump Test/ Compressive strength test Report at 28 days/Pre pour inspection checklist
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Engineers Approval

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Following the concrete pour and stripping out form works: the concrete shall be inspected for Size, Shape, Features, inserts, reliefs, and Finish against the drawings.
Verifying Document - Visual Inspection / Post pour checklist
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Pour
Detail - Tolerance on the placement of internal forms and moulds shall be +-5mm
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Moulds shall be rigid accurately formed and of sufficient strength and stiffness to prevent distortion under vibration.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Pre Pour inspection to check:

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Engineer shall be informed 8 hours prior to the casting of any unit, to allow the Engineer to attend the pre-casting plant to inspect before and during production of the units. Pre pour inspection for 1st pour, there after every 3rd pour
○ Reinforcing shall be pre assembled wherever possible into rigid cages using a template or jig. Reinforcing shall be tied together with wire unless otherwise accepted by the Engineer
○ Confirm correct type and location of cover block is used.
Verifying Document - Pre pour inspection checklist, Manufacturer QA records
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Engineers Approval
Detail - Pre cast Methodology from Pre co to submit to Engineer and Compression Test Report

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - For pours under 150m³: three standard cylinders shall be made for each 50m³ of concrete placed, or part thereof, for testing of 28 days compressive strength in an approved laboratory.

○ For repetitive precast underpass units with 6.42m3 each pours undertaken on a regular basis, three standard cylinders shall be made for each of the first five pours of any one type, and thereafter three standard cylinders shall be made for every fifth pour of that type for testing of 28 days compressive strength in an approved laboratory.
Verifying Document - Slump Test/ Compressive strength test Report at 28 days/Pre pour inspection checklist
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Engineers Approval

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Following the concrete pour and stripping out form works: the concrete shall be inspected for Size, Shape, Features, inserts, reliefs, and Finish against the drawings.
Verifying Document - Visual Inspection/ Post pour checklist
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Pour

Detail - Joint sealing of pre cast members

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Joints are to be sealed using a fuel resistant, multi-component polysulphide sealant designed for horizontal and vertical joints in concrete and is joint sealant pourable or gunning grade as appropriate.
Verifying Document - Post installation inspection check list
